channel.title: International News,More on NewsStreet
channel.description: Recent content in International News,More on NewsStreet

item.title: Rights Activists welcome US resolution on Bangladesh genocide by Pakistan
item.description: Rights Activists welcome US resolution on Bangladesh genocide by Pakistan The Human Rights Congress for Bangladesh Minorities (HRCBM) held the conference Friday to discuss the recent introduction of the bipartisan House Resolution 1430

item.title: Chinese President Xi Jinping wants Chinese army to focus on military might, achieve goals by 2027
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping wants Chinese army to focus on military might, achieve goals by 2027 The Chinese leader Xi Jinping has asked the military to complete its missions and build the military into a world-class force

item.title: Labour puts pressure on new UK PM Rishi Sunak over Suella Braverman reappointment
item.description: Labour puts pressure on new UK PM Rishi Sunak over Suella Braverman reappointment Sunak is under growing pressure over reinstating Braverman as home secretary after a former party chair claimed she had committed "

item.title: South Korea: Death toll in Seoul halloween stampede mounts to 153, President Yoon announces period of national mourning
item.description: South Korea: Death toll in Seoul halloween stampede mounts to 153, President Yoon announces period of national mourning It was the first Halloween event in Seoul in three years after the country lifted many COVID-19 restrictions, most of the people were wearing Halloween costumes.

item.title: Pakistani rupee continues downward trajectory for the third consecutive session
item.description: Pakistani rupee continues downward trajectory for the third consecutive session Some of the factors domestically caused scepticism in the market which resulted in the depreciation of the local currency

item.title: Twitter in 'sane hands' but can't be successful without me, says former US President Donald Trump
item.description: Twitter in ‘sane hands’ but can’t be successful without me, says former US President Donald Trump Trump has hailed Elon Musk for acquiring Twitter for $44 billion, saying the micro-blogging platform is now in “sane hands”.

item.title: Former Pakistani PM Imran Khan terminates party member Faisal Vawda for sabotaging long march
item.description: Former Pakistani PM Imran Khan terminates party member Faisal Vawda for sabotaging long march Khan has terminated the membership of party leader Faisal Vawda after he claimed the party’s Haqeeqi march would be “bloody,”

item.title: Rishi Sunak will be a fantastic Prime Minister, says UK Foreign Secretary James Cleverly
item.description: Rishi Sunak will be a fantastic Prime Minister, says UK Foreign Secretary James Cleverly Cleverly stressed the need to curb the exploitation of emerging technologies and starving terrorists of the vital funds used in terror activities.

item.title: No relief for Pakistan as Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) continues to slump
item.description: No relief for Pakistan as Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) continues to slump The outflows for the months stood at USD 63 million, rising by 130 per cent year-on-year, and leaving net FDI of less than USD 84, down by 66 per cent year-on-year

item.title: 'Our Obama moment': United Kingdom (UK) Hindu temple leader Sanjay Chandarana on Rishi Sunak becoming PM
item.description: ‘Our Obama moment’: United Kingdom (UK) Hindu temple leader Sanjay Chandarana on Rishi Sunak becoming PM “It’s the Obama moment, where a non-white person becomes PM for the first time, also a person from India and Hindu which is another dimension and pride,” says Chandarana

item.title: 2 missing Indians killed in East African country Kenya
item.description: 2 missing Indians killed in East African country Kenya India has described as “very disturbing” the events surrounding the abduction of its nationals in Kenya and the subsequent lack of information in the case.

item.title: Cyclone Sitrang kills 15 people in Bangladesh coasts
item.description: Cyclone Sitrang kills 15 people in Bangladesh coasts With high winds and heavy rains, the cyclone erased houses, crops and infrastructure in a vast swath of the country while most of the casualties were caused by falling trees

item.title: Italian PM Giorgia Meloni thanks Tibetan spiritual leader Dalai Lama
item.description: Italian PM Giorgia Meloni thanks Tibetan spiritual leader Dalai Lama Italian PM Giorgia Meloni thanked Tibetan spiritual leader the Dalai Lama for the message of affection by him on her appointment.

item.title: India will always stand with the Global South, says External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar
item.description: India will always stand with the Global South, says External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar S Jaishankar articulated both infringements of India’s core interests as well as issues of pressing global concern including the long impending UN reforms.

item.title: Pakistan convinces Saudi Arabia to set up $12 bn refinery, petrochemical complex
item.description: Pakistan convinces Saudi Arabia to set up $12 bn refinery, petrochemical complex The Pakistani side, according to the report, made huge efforts to persuade the kingdom to honour the MoUs and invest in the South Asian nation.
